text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Local elections will be held in Macedonia on September 17 to elect mayors and local assemblies in 123 municipalities. The information ministry will determine criteria for "equal presentation of all political parties in the media".

- Central bank governors of Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Macedonia accept the criteria for the division of assets of the former Yugoslavia proposad by the Board of Directors of the Basle Bank for International Settlements.
- The ruling Social democratic Alliance of Macedonia (SDAM) accepted to the Socialist International.
- Bulgaria and Macedonia fail to find a solution to their language dispute. Over 15 agreements could not be signed.

- Representatives of Macedonian parties from Tetovo and Gostivar (western Macedonia, with ethnic Albanian majority) will refrain from expressing dissatisfaction with the territorial division law at rallies and public gatherings.
- The Macedonian government adopts bill on the ratification of the economic agreement with Yugoslavia.
